TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LinearInt16KeyFrame extends System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int16KeyFrame

Docs.summary: Animates from the value of the previous key frame to its own using linear interpolation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is used as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int16KeyFrameCollection> in conjunction with a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int16AnimationUsingKeyFrames> to animate a <xref:System.Int16> property value along a set of key frames.
A key frame defines a segment of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int16AnimationUsingKeyFrames> to which it belongs. Each key frame has a target <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int16KeyFrame.Value%2A> and a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int16KeyFrame.KeyTime%2A>. The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int16KeyFrame.KeyTime%2A> specifies the time at which the key frame's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int16KeyFrame.Value%2A> should be reached. A key frame animates from the target value of the previous key frame to its own target value. It starts when the previous key frame ends and ends when its own key time is reached.
Linear key frames like <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.LinearInt16KeyFrame> create a smooth, linear interpolation between values.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int16 value, valuetype System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime keyTime) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: Ending value (also known as "target value") for the key frame.
Key time for the key frame. The key time determines when the target value is reached which is also when the key frame ends.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified ending value and key time.

protected override short InterpolateValueCore (short baseValue, double keyFrameProgress);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance int16 InterpolateValueCore(int16 baseValue, float64 keyFrameProgress) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function InterpolateValueCore (baseValue As Short, keyFrameProgress As Double) As Short
protected: override short InterpolateValueCore(short baseValue, double keyFrameProgress);

Docs.param: A value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive, that specifies the percentage of time that has elapsed for this key frame.
Docs.summary: Interpolates, in a linear fashion, between the previous key frame value and the value of the current key frame, using the supplied progress increment.
Docs.returns: The output value of this key frame given the specified base value and progress.
